page.title: 19GARDENS AND ALLOTMENTS.
page.content: Plants are started in the greenhouse, then into a cold frame to harden off. Seeds are bought from catalogus and local shops. Fertilizies and sprays have to be brought.Chemicals to kill bugs and slugs. People are keen on gardening as they leave spare time. The Allotment. An allotment is a field in plots to grow vegetables. There is piped water for the plant.Each person has a strip of land with different rows of vegetables. They were having trouble with weeds and badgers using it as a toilet.Wind breaks are built to protect plants.Growing plants is fairly cheap.There seems to be a growing intrest in flowers and shrubs.Flymo mowers are popular.Fertilizes are cow dung and potash.There are many radio and t.v programmes on gardening.
